A smart toothbrush that utilizes AI technology to provide personalized brushing techniques and tracks brushing habits to improve oral hygiene. The toothbrush could have a built-in microphone and speaker to play guided brushing audio, ensuring that users brush for the full recommended 2 minutes. Additionally, the toothbrush could have sensors to detect when the user is brushing too hard or not hard enough, providing real-time feedback to improve brushing technique.

A toothbrush with a built-in tongue scraper to help remove bacteria and debris from the tongue, improving overall oral hygiene. The tongue scraper could be retractable, making it easy to use and clean. The toothbrush could also have a built-in tongue brush to help clean the tongue more effectively.

A toothbrush with interchangeable heads that can be swapped out when they wear out, extending the life of the toothbrush. The heads could be designed for different oral hygiene needs, such as whitening, plaque removal, or sensitive teeth. The toothbrush could also have a built-in UV sanitizer to kill bacteria on the heads.

A toothbrush with a built-in water flosser to provide an additional cleaning option for between teeth and below the gumline. The water flosser could be adjustable for different water pressure and could be used with or without toothpaste. The toothbrush could also have a built-in tongue scraper for added oral hygiene benefits.

A toothbrush with a built-in Bluetooth connectivity feature that allows users to track their brushing habits and oral hygiene progress through a mobile app. The app could provide personalized recommendations for improving oral hygiene and offer rewards for consistent brushing. The toothbrush could also have a built-in timer and pressure sensor to ensure that users brush for the full recommended time and use the right amount of pressure.
